name: Brave - Noble Maiden Fair A Mhaighdean Bhan Uasal

content.text:
Hi! So I've been learning Gàidhlig and I wanted to learn this song for vowel practice, but there weren't any 
tabs of it. So I'm fixing that! This is the song that Queen Eleanor sings to young Merida in the flashback.
Lyrics were found on the Brave Wiki.

Tips for pronunciation: Bh/Mh is pronounced more like a "Vh" sound (bhan= vahn, mhaighdean = vhaeghdan, ect.)
, "Dh" is practically silent. "Gh" is a hard,
almost phlegm-y "Gchh" sound. Good luck!
EDIT: I switched out the chord G6 for Gma7 because that's how I prefer to play it, but either works.

Noble Maiden Fair (A Mhaighden Bhan Uasal)

chords:	  [F]            [Eb]

	(etc.)

	And you [C] listen with a [F] tear in [Bb] your eye
	to their [C] hopes and be[F]trayels and your [Bb] only reply
	is Slainte mhath.

The guitar-riff starts again, with the same chords:

And that's all folks!

Ramin Djawadi - Mhysa (Mother in Old Ghiscari and later Low Valyrian)
Daenerys' Theme at the end of season 3 of Game of Thrones.
Tabbed by Kate
Tuning: Standard
Capo: None (Optional to your voice/liking.)
Translations and High Valyrian are taken from David Peterson's blog on the Dothraki.com website.

This song is  supposed to be sung in High Valyrian... Before I tabbed this
song, I did a lot of research on the lyrics.I soon found out that the creator
of the Dothraki and High Valyrian languages for the show did not write the
lyrics for this song.Instead, Ramin Djawadi wrote them. They are supposed to
be based off of Daenery's speech which I have included at the bottom of this
tablature for your referencing. But because Djawadi wanted to change the
sound of his choir's voices for the song, the ending result is that the
lyrics sound nothing like Daenery's speech to the people of Yunkai that she
frees at the end of the 3rd season. So, we're gonna have to settle for "la"s!
So please bear with me, as I try to tab an absolutely beautiful song that
should be taken seriously, with "la la, la-da-la la" lyrics! I am using the
lyrics just as a point of reference for the music.
These are NOT the proper lyrics, they're just me sounding out the choir's unknown words, 
so... Valar dohaerys! Valar morghulis!

Daenerys' speech in High Valyrian:
"Daervose jevosy yne enkot daor. Jemot ziry tepagon koston daor.
Daerves jevys tepagon yne sytilibos daor. Jemele meri sytilibas.
Lo ziry arli jaelat, jemelo syt ziry mazemagon jemo bevilza. Tolvies jemys."

Daenerys' speech in English:
"You do not owe me your freedom. I cannot give it to you.
Your freedom is not mine to give. It belongs to you and you alone.
If you want it back, you must take it for yourselves. Each and every one of you."

    [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]

   [ch]Dm[/ch]                                  [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]
"I love my love because I know my love loves me"


[Verse 2]

"Oh, cruel were his parents who sent my love to sea
                                    [ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]Dm[/ch]
And cruel was the sailing ship that bore my love from me
       [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]Dm[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]

                                 [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]Dm[/ch]
